list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A man suddenly appeared round the corner.
He appeared in time for dinner.

list_definition.definition: to come before or present oneself/itself before the public or a judge etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He is appearing on television today

list_definition.definition: to look or seem as if (something is the case)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: It appears that he is wrong

list_ex_of_english: When fused the top pyramid will appear to protrude as shading and disparity are in concert.
Purely indefinite readings appear to be more exceptional, yet in some contexts they provide a plausible interpretation of a given gerund construction.
Continuing treatment appears to have a protective effect against relapse.
This can make study findings appear redundant as the health service rushes on to experiment with the next new initiative.
The analysis of the qualitative data appears, unfortunately, to have been somewhat superficial.
Thus, the dissipation of volume appears for purely topological reasons.
Readers, it appears, were invited to engage in reflexive fantasy by associating their desired state of being with that of a trained psychologist.
But farm size does not appear to explain differences in yields and net returns when the technology is adopted.
